nodes.title: TV Show Writer Overlap Application
nodes.metadata_json:
{"confidence":90,"prompt":"We are building an application that shows us how writers from various shows overlap and have other shows that one might want to see if they were into their original work

We will be displaying this as a combination of a pannable graph and also a series of Venn diagrams for shows with writer overlap

Begin by making a quick and dirty tv show scraper for writers on IMDB.

We will be seeding this with 10 shows to climb through and shake the tree for all writers of

the scraper can be written in python quick and dirty

use SQLite to store everything

We then will have a web application running react/typescript that uses vite and vitest to manage things and lints to ensure that we don't use any any() types

Build it in the style of functional core imperative shell and push the complexity and imperative operations to the edges for clean pure functions in the middle

Make sure to test the function composition

You will start with the quick and dirty scraper, seed with these ten shows

Gilmore girls
Scrubs
Better off Ted
The Rehearsal
Arrested Development
Jury Duty
Brooklyn Nine Nine
Bob's Burgers
King of the Hill
Santa Clarita Diet

With those ten shows seeded, we will start to build the graph + Venn diagram review, try 3 drafts of your own making and then show me all of them

use deciduous to track ALL decisions in depth and make sure you record them BEFORE you do something

use git branches to separate each "concept""}

nodes.title: Scraper technology choice
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"Choose Python with requests/BeautifulSoup for quick IMDB scraping"}

nodes.title: Database schema design
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"SQLite with normalized tables: shows, writers, show_writers"}

nodes.title: Web app architecture
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"React/TypeScript with Vite, functional core imperative shell pattern"}

nodes.title: Implementing IMDB scraper
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":85,"prompt":"Creating Python scraper using requests and BeautifulSoup to extract writer credits from IMDB show pages"}

nodes.title: IMDB fullcredits page structure different than expected
Scraper successfully extracted 271 writers from 10 shows with 10 overlapping
Scraper committed and working
Creating React/TypeScript web application with Vite
Three visualization drafts approach
nodes.metadata_json: {"branch":"feature/web-app","confidence":90,"prompt":"Draft 1: Force-directed graph - shows as nodes connected by edges weighted by shared writers\nDraft 2: Interactive Venn diagram - select 2-3 shows to see writer overlap\nDraft 3: Matrix heatmap - grid showing shared writer counts between all show pairs"}

put the writers in alphabetical order with 10 writers listed at a time

use pagination to create the additional pages for the list

document each decision you make using deciduous"}

nodes.title: Implementation approach for writer details
Updated database schema with image_url and bio columns
Created writer details scraper for images and bios
Updated API with paginated writers endpoint and writer details
Created WriterDirectory component with pagination
Integrated WriterDirectory into App with new tab
Fixed bio extraction path in scraper - using aboveTheFold.bio
Add go-to-page and search for WriterDirectory
Search implementation: server-side vs client-side
Server-side search chosen: 3218 writers too many for client-side filtering
Added search parameter to paginated writers API
Added search and go-to-page to WriterDirectory component
Search and go-to-page features complete
Redesign Venn Diagram with better layout and interactions
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","confidence":90,"prompt":"do not let words overlap in the venn diagram

show writer names on the outside circles and then inside of the intersection list the show names

make the shows and writers clickable

make the Venn Diagram pretty

make the Venn Diagram larger when clicked on

and as always document your decisions using deciduous"}

nodes.title: Venn diagram layout: writers in circles, shows in intersections
Venn diagram redesign complete - writers on circles, shows in intersections, click-to-expand, all elements clickable to IMDB
Venn expansion: in-place vs modal overlay
Chose in-place expansion - simpler UX, no modal overlay, diagram grows dynamically based on writer count
Implemented dynamic sizing: SVG scales based on maxUniqueWriters, shows all writer names, all overlapping writers visible
Venn diagram now expands in-place with all writers visible - dynamic sizing, all intersection writers shown, toggle button for expand/collapse
Writer label layout: multi-layer radial positioning vs single ring
Multi-layer approach chosen: calculates writers per layer based on arc spacing (90px), distributes writers across rings at increasing radii (22px layer spacing)
Implemented layered label positioning: getWriterPositions now returns layer info, dynamic SVG sizing accounts for layers, CSS centers expanded diagram
Venn diagram now shows all writer names in spaced layers, diagram centered when expanded, outer layers have subtle opacity fade for visual hierarchy
Writer label display: SVG radial labels vs HTML lists below diagram
Chose HTML lists over SVG labels: guarantees no overlap, cleaner layout, better readability, clickable names in organized columns
Rewrote VennDiagram: SVG shows circles with show names, writer lists in HTML below, centered with flexbox, grid layout for shared writers
Venn diagram centered, all writer names visible without overlap, clean organized lists, all names clickable to IMDB
Venn layout: full-width SVG with writers in positioned columns vs fixed-size with radial labels
Full-width responsive SVG matches container, unique writers in vertical columns outside circles (left/right/top based on position), shared writers displayed inside intersection areas
Implemented: useRef measures container width, SVG viewBox scales responsively, getLabelArea positions writer lists by circle location, shared writers centered in intersections
Venn diagram matches show selector width, unique writers in columns outside circles, shared writers inside intersections, all clickable to IMDB
Venn layout v3: larger circles filling container, writer lists with connecting lines, intersection cards below
Implemented: dynamic radius based on container width (availableWidth/3), dashed connecting lines from writer lists to circles, intersection cards showing shared writers with show names
Venn circles fill container, unique writers connected to circles with dashed lines, intersection cards show writer overlaps with show names
Enlarged Venn diagram and improved circle styling
Moved unique writer lists to HTML section below diagram with per-list expand buttons
Venn diagram now 450px tall with large pretty circles, unique writer lists below diagram with per-list expand buttons for lists >10 writers, intersection cards also expandable
Venn text positioning: center vs unique area
Text at circle centers gets covered when circles overlap - moved text to unique (non-overlapping) areas of each circle using textX/textY offsets
Increased SVG to 550px height, baseRadius to 180px max, added textX/textY to position labels in unique areas
Venn diagram circles much larger (up to 180px radius), text labels positioned in unique areas so no overlap when circles intersect
Added SVG title tooltips to circles and intersection badge
Increased SVG height to 700px, baseRadius to 220px, larger fonts and stroke widths
Venn diagram now shows tooltips on hover with show details, circles are much larger (220px radius, 700px height), improved visibility
SVG click handling: pointer-events approach
SVG elements stack in document order; circles were blocking clicks on text links. Solution: pointerEvents='none' on decorative circles, render labels in separate pass on top
Split circles into two render passes: decorative circles with pointerEvents=none first, then clickable labels with invisible hit rect on top
Show title links in Venn diagram circles are now fully clickable - invisible 200x100 hit rect ensures easy clicking
Implement 5-Show Venn + Writer Modal Features
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","confidence":100,"prompt":"Implement the following plan:

# Implementation Plan: Writer Click Modal + 5-Show Venn Diagram

## Summary
Two features:
1. **Clickable Writers**: In Show Browser, clicking a writer name opens a modal showing all their shows with "Add to Venn" buttons
2. **5-Show Venn**: Expand diagram from 3 to 5 shows with proper positioning and intersection handling"}

Added 5-show positioning (pentagon) in getCirclePositions
Add comprehensive test suite for functional core
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","confidence":100,"prompt":"lets go thrgough this codebase and give it a thorough review

we want to shoot for having a functional core and imperative shell

the functional core should be unit tested but also have its compositional aspects tested too 

they should resemble the real process and usage in those tests

use vitest

once we have the tests, lets go through any eliminate ALL any() type usage and get very explicit contracts going"}

Create comprehensive tutorial page
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","confidence":100,"prompt":"We are going to do something kind of lofty.

I want to make a new page.

This page is going to be a tutorial of _how this entire app was made_

Since you did so much work, I want to be able to implement it myself from scratch.

It should be organized into sections and truly go from the ground up and explain every concept and choice

It should also have review questions for each major decision and architectural piece that we stick with

It should be done referencing both the commit history and the deciduous graph"}

nodes.title: Tutorial page completed with 8 sections and review questions
